007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.Triangle;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a regular octahedron
015   with its center at the origin, having side length
016   {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},with its center plane given
017   by the four vertices {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with
018   the top and bottom vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
019<p>
020   See <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octahedron" target="_top">
021                http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octahedron</a>
022
023   @see Tetrahedron
024   @see Cube
025   @see Icosahedron
026   @see Dodecahedron
027*/
028public class Octahedron extends Model implements MeshMaker
029{
030   public final int n1;
031   public final int n2;
032   public final int n3;
033   public final int n4;
034
035   /**
036      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
037      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
038      with its center plane given by the four vertices
039      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
040      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
041   */
042   public Octahedron()
043   {
044      super("Octahedron");
045
046      this.n1 = 0;
047      this.n2 = 0;
048      this.n3 = 0;
049      this.n4 = 0;
050
051      // Create the octahedron's geometry.
052      // It has 6 vertices, 12 edges, and 8 faces.
053      addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  0,  0),  // four vertices around the center plane
054                new Vertex( 0,  0, -1),
055                new Vertex(-1,  0,  0),
056                new Vertex( 0,  0,  1),
057                new Vertex( 0,  1,  0),  // vertex at the top
058                new Vertex( 0, -1,  0)); // vertex at the bottom
059/*
060      // These vertices create an Octahedron with side length 1.
061      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0),
062                   sqrt2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
063      addVertex(new Vertex( 0.5, 0,  0.5), // 4 vertices around the center plane
064                new Vertex(-0.5, 0,  0.5),
065                new Vertex(-0.5, 0, -0.5),
066                new Vertex( 0.5, 0, -0.5),
067                new Vertex( 0,  1/sqrt2, 0),  // vertex at the top
068                new Vertex( 0, -1/sqrt2, 0)); // vertex at the bottom
069*/
070      // Create 8 triangles.
071      addPrimitive(new Triangle(4, 1, 0),  // top half
072                   new Triangle(4, 0, 3),
073                   new Triangle(4, 2, 1),
074                   new Triangle(4, 3, 2),
075                   new Triangle(5, 0, 1),  /// bottom half
076                   new Triangle(5, 3, 0),
077                   new Triangle(5, 1, 2),
078                   new Triangle(5, 2, 3));
079   }
080
081
082   /**
083      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
084      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
085      with its center plane given by the four vertices
086      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
087      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
088      <p>
089      Add line segments fanning out from the top and bottom
090      vertices to the sides around the center plane.
091
092      @param n number of lines fanning out from the top and bottom on each side of the octahedron
093      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
094   */
095   public Octahedron(final int n)
096   {
097      this(n, n, n, n);
098   }
099
100
101   /**
102      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
103      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
104      with its center plane given by the four vertices
105      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
106      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
107      <p>
108      Add line segments fanning out from each vertex to
109      its opposite sides.
110
111      @param n1 number of lines fanning out from the top and bottom on each side of the octahedron
112      @param n2 number of lines fanning out from v0 and v2 on each side of the octahedron
113      @param n3 number of lines fanning out from v1 and v3 on each side of the octahedron
114      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1} is less than 0
115      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2} is less than 0
116      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n3} is less than 0
117   */
118   public Octahedron(final int n1, final int n2)
119   {
120      this(n1, n2, n1, n2);
121   }
122
123
124   /**
125      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
126      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
127      with its center plane given by the four vertices
128      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
129      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
130      <p>
131      Add line segments fanning out from each vertex to
132      its opposite sides.
133
134      @param n1 number of lines fanning out from the top & bottom to the 1st edge
135      @param n2 number of lines fanning out from the top & bottom to the 2nd edge
136      @param n3 number of lines fanning out from the top & bottom to the 3rd edge
137      @param n4 number of lines fanning out from the top & bottom to the 4th edge
138      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1} is less than 0
139      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2} is less than 0
140      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n3} is less than 0
141      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n4} is less than 0
142   */
143   public Octahedron(final int n1, final int n2,
144                     final int n3, final int n4)
145   {
146      super(String.format("Octahedron(%d,%d,%d,%d)", n1, n2, n3, n4));
147
148      if (n1 < 0)
149         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n1 must be greater than or equal to 0");
150      if (n2 < 0)
151         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n2 must be greater than or equal to 0");
152      if (n3 < 0)
153         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n3 must be greater than or equal to 0");
154      if (n4 < 0)
155         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n4 must be greater than or equal to 0");
156
157      this.n1 = n1;
158      this.n2 = n2;
159      this.n3 = n3;
160      this.n4 = n4;
161
162      // Create the octahedron's geometry.
163      // It has 6 vertices and 12 edges.
164      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( 1,  0,  0); // 4 vertices around the center plane
165      final Vertex v1 = new Vertex( 0,  0, -1);
166      final Vertex v2 = new Vertex(-1,  0,  0);
167      final Vertex v3 = new Vertex( 0,  0,  1);
168      final Vertex v4 = new Vertex( 0,  1,  0); // vertex at the top
169      final Vertex v5 = new Vertex( 0, -1,  0); // vertex at the bottom
170      addVertex(v0, v1, v2, v3, v4, v5);
171/*
172      // These vertices create an Octahedron with side length 1.
173      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
174      final double sqrt2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
175      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( 0.5, 0,  0.5); // 4 vertices around the center plane
176      final Vertex v1 = new Vertex(-0.5, 0,  0.5);
177      final Vertex v2 = new Vertex(-0.5, 0, -0.5);
178      final Vertex v3 = new Vertex( 0.5, 0, -0.5);
179      final Vertex v4 = new Vertex( 0,  1/sqrt2, 0); // vertex at the top
180      final Vertex v5 = new Vertex( 0, -1/sqrt2, 0); // vertex at the bottom
181      addVertex(v0, v1, v2, v3, v4, v5);
182*/
183      // Create eight triangular faces.
184      // Make sure the faces are all
185      // oriented in the same way!
186      // Remember that front facing
187      // should be counter-clockwise
188      // (and back facing is clock-wise).
189      addPrimitive(new Triangle(4, 1, 0),  // top half
190                   new Triangle(4, 0, 3),
191                   new Triangle(4, 2, 1),
192                   new Triangle(4, 3, 2),
193                   new Triangle(5, 0, 1),  // bottom half
194                   new Triangle(5, 3, 0),
195                   new Triangle(5, 1, 2),
196                   new Triangle(5, 2, 3));
197
198      // The faces fanning out from the top an bottom seem
199      // to be oriented correctly. Each set of faces fanning
200      // out from a vertex are oriented the same. But at least
201      // one set of faces seems to be oriented opposite of what
202      // it should be.
203      fan(n1, 4,  1, 0); // fan out from v4 to edge (v0, v1)
204      fan(n1, 5,  0, 1); // fan out from v5 to edge (v0, v1)
205      fan(n2, 4,  2, 1); // fan out from v4 to edge (v1, v2)
206      fan(n2, 5,  1, 2); // fan out from v5 to edge (v1, v2)
207      fan(n3, 4,  3, 2); // fan out from v4 to edge (v2, v3)
208      fan(n3, 5,  2, 3); // fan out from v5 to edge (v2, v3)
209      fan(n4, 4,  0, 3); // fan out from v4 to edge (v3, v0)
210      fan(n4, 5,  3, 0); // fan out from v5 to edge (v3, v0)
211   }
212
213
214   /**
215      Create {@code n} line segments fanning out from {@link Vertex}
216      {@code v0} towards the edge spanned by the other two vertices.
217
218      @param n    number of lines fanning out from {@link Vertex} {@code v0}
219      @param v0   index in the {@link Vertex} list of the vertex to fan out from
220      @param v1i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
221      @param v2i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
222   */
223   private void fan(final int n, final int v0, final int v1i,
224                                               final int v2i)
225   {
226      final Vertex v1 = vertexList.get(v1i);
227      final Vertex v2 = vertexList.get(v2i);
228
229      // Create vertices along the edge from v1 to v2.
230      int index = vertexList.size();
231      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
232      {
233         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
234         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
235         final double x = (1-t) * v1.x + t * v2.x;
236         final double y = (1-t) * v1.y + t * v2.y;
237         final double z = (1-t) * v1.z + t * v2.z;
238         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
239      }
240      // Create n triangles.
241      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Triangle(v0, v1i, index));
242      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
243      {
244         addPrimitive(new Triangle(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
245      }
246   }
247
248
249
250   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
251   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return this.n1;}
252
253   @Override public int getVertCount() {return this.n2;}
254
255   @Override
256   public Octahedron remake(final int n, final int k)
257   {
258      return new Octahedron(n, k);
259   }
260}//Octahedron
